source.pile_forces

get_pile_disp

Get the rigid body point displacement of pile’s support location

pile_react_force

API

source.pile_forces.get_pile_disp(x_t: numpy.typing.NDArray[numpy.float64], r: numpy.typing.NDArray[numpy.float64]) → numpy.typing.NDArray[numpy.float64][source]

Get the rigid body point displacement of pile’s support location

Displacement of point on rigid body, calculated using basic geometry.

Input

  1. x_t: rigid body 6-dof generalized position at time t, [3 x (m), 3 x (rad)]

  2. r: vector from rigid body center of rotation to the point, (float 2) m

Return

Returns the coordinate of the displaced point

source.pile_forces.pile_react_force(x_t: numpy.typing.NDArray[numpy.float64], Xbody: numpy.typing.NDArray[numpy.float64], pile_xs: numpy.typing.NDArray[numpy.float64], pile_k: numpy.typing.NDArray[numpy.float64]) → numpy.typing.NDArray[numpy.float64][source]

Get the total pile reaction

Pile force is calculated from assumed linear properties of the pile and pile displacements. The total body force includes non-coplanar forces that cause moment the the rigid body. See Linear Pile Force Thoery for more detailed information.

Input

  1. x_t: rigid body 6-dof generalized position at time t, [3 x (m), 3 x (rad)]

  2. Xbody: rigid body center of rotation, (float 3) (m)

  3. pile_xs: pile locations array(x, y), [x y] x N_pile (m)

  4. pile_k: linearized pile stiffness matrix, (float 4 x 4)

Return

Return the total pile reaction in term of 6-dof generalized force
